intro: Paraboea berouwensis, commonly known as the Bornean paraboea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an epiphyte or terrestrial plant in humid, shaded environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its habitat.
